ai-mil7.5.5:1.1_0: “An elephant who belongs to a family of Nāgadatta, you must go to that place?”
ai-mil7.5.5:1.2_0: “Great king, as Prince Abhaya and Bakudha Kaccāyana, he was going to the Acacia.
ai-mil7.5.5:1.3_0: In the same way, a great king, overcome by anger, causes anger, hostility, disdain, contempt, jealousy, stinginess, deceit, deviousness, obstinacy, and deceitful.
ai-mil7.5.5:1.4_0: This is not possible, great king, that one should not be chest down.
ai-mil7.5.5:1.5_0: When you’ve spoken like this, great king, you won’t honor the senior monks,
ai-mil7.5.5:2.3_0: He should look out with a mind of love,
ai-mil7.5.5:2.4_0: this is the instruction of the Buddhas.’”
